comments.body: did this work before for directories??

This was just moved down into if-branch. Previously this was done even if we were copying the whole tree which is unnecessary and shutils on windows don't like it. It would fail with path already exists.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +330,334 @@    if os.path.isfile(src):
        dst_dirpath = os.path.dirname(dst_path)
        if not os.path.exists(dst_dirpath):
            os.makedirs(dst_dirpath)
        shutil.copy(src=src, dst=dst_path)

comments.body: Btw, Python-based gzip is known to be very slow in comparison to the `GNU tar` utility. We may later want to go back to using that if we see this come up in practice.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +243,247 @@        # When gzipping the tar, don't include the tar's filename or modification time in the
        # zipped archive (see https://docs.python.org/3/library/gzip.html#gzip.GzipFile)
        with gzip.GzipFile(filename="", fileobj=open(output_filename, 'wb'), mode='wb', mtime=0)\
                as gzipped_tar, open(unzipped_filename, 'rb') as tar:
            gzipped_tar.write(tar.read())

comments.body: You should document that this looks at a docker ignore file if one exists. Should it also do gitignore?
